channel.title: Stage6 trustable?
channel.description:
Well, I was about to watch an episode of Metalocalypse on tvl-links.co.uk and stage6 had some episodes. So I click on one of the links, and it asks me to install a divx player. When I install it, Norton (yes Norton :P, this can be the problem) pops up saying that one of the files from the divx player plugin contains a virus called Bloodhound.Overpacked. What do I have to do? Can I just disable Norton or is it really a virus?
Thanks in advance.

item.title: Stage6 trustable?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Oh ok. Well I suppose I dont need to use it anymore, because I torrented the episodes that I wanted to see. Anyways, thanks for helping.

Read full topic

item.title: Stage6 trustable?
item.dc:creator: @Tidus_Strife Tidus Strife
item.description:
@Tidus_Strife wrote:

Divx is very trustable. It’s great 10000x better then youtube expecially graphics wise.

Norton …eh lol dont listen to it.

Read full topic

item.title: Stage6 trustable?
item.dc:creator: @dragonus18 dragonus18
item.description:
@dragonus18 wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:11, topic:146085”]Idiots, “Bloodhound” means that Norton picked it up using “Bloodhound heuristics” (detects uncatalogged viruses using several detection methods), and Overpacked is like when Clam AV detects an oversized file as a virus.

It’s nothing at all, don’t worry, and you were right, Norton was the problem. Disable Bloodhound heuristics (they’re practically useless) and download/install the plugin normally.[/quote]

jsut download it off the official site to be safe and if it says you still need it DON’T download it form that site

Read full topic

item.title: Stage6 trustable?
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Idiots, “Bloodhound” means that Norton picked it up using “Bloodhound heuristics” (detects uncatalogged viruses using several detection methods), and Overpacked is like when Clam AV detects an oversized file as a virus.

It’s nothing at all, don’t worry, and you were right, Norton was the problem. Disable Bloodhound heuristics (they’re practically useless) and download/install the plugin normally.

Read full topic

item.title: Stage6 trustable?
item.dc:creator: @robocz033 robocz033
item.description:
@robocz033 wrote:

yea, just download DivX from the official site. then you should be good.

Read full topic

item.title: Stage6 trustable?
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Nah, tv-links is clean. Stage6 is also clean, but you can download DivX off the official site.

Read full topic

item.title: Stage6 trustable?
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

I don’t know the site but there is always the slight chance that someone binded the exe with a malicious program. Although I don’t know the site, I would still probably take my chances over norton (for future virus scanning needs goto virusscan.jotti.org :))

Read full topic

item.description:
@robocz033 wrote:

i love tv-links.co.uk!

but i definately would go with what norton says. or google it. because that sounds like a ferocious virus if its anything like the dog. so i would stay on the safe side, let norton deal with it, and just view the episode from a different source.

try googling first. or just go with a different source if possible.
